metadata.title: CVE-2014-1878 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the cmd_submitf function in cgi/cmd.c inNagios Core, possibly 4.0.3rc1 and earlier, and Icinga before 1.8.6, 1.9before 1.9.5, and 1.10 before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (segmentation fault) via a long message to cmd.cgi.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nagios3 - 3.5.1-1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-cgi - 3.5.1-1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-common - 3.5.1-1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-core - 3.5.1-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

icinga - 1.10.3
icinga-cgi - 1.10.3
icinga-common - 1.10.3
icinga-core - 1.10.3
icinga-idoutils - 1.10.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nagios3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.1-1ubuntu1.1').
icinga package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3').
